00001 #include <stdio.h>
00002 #include <string.h>
00003 #include <stdlib.h>
00004 
00005 char *cmdname;          /* should point to argv[0] */
00006 
00007 char command[BUFSIZ];   /* command given to xargs */
00008 char line[BUFSIZ];      /* current input line */        
00009 char cmdbuf[BUFSIZ];    /* command + input lines */
00010 
00011 main(argc, argv)
00012         int argc;
00013         char *argv[];
00014 {
00015         cmdname = argv[0];
00016 
00017         /* skip (xargs) command name */
00018 
00019         argv++, argc--;
00020 
00021         /* construct command from arguments */
00022 
00023         (void) strcpy(command, "exec");
00024         while (argc--) {
00025                 (void) strcat(command, " ");
00026                 (void) strcat(command, *argv++);
00027         }
00028 
00029         /* initialize for command execution loop */
00030 
00031         (void) strcpy(cmdbuf, command);
00032 
00033         /* here's where all the action is: read in arguments
00034          * from stdin, appending to the current command buffer
00035          * if next line would overflow command buffer, execute
00036          * command buffer and reinitialize
00037          */
00038 
00039         while (gets(line) != NULL) {
00040 
00041                 /* the "+2" is for the blank and trailing null char */
00042 
00043                 if (strlen(cmdbuf)+strlen(line)+2 > BUFSIZ) {
00044                         (void) docmd(cmdbuf);
00045                         (void) strcpy(cmdbuf, command);
00046                 }
00047                 (void) strcat(cmdbuf, " ");
00048                 (void) strcat(cmdbuf, line);
00049         }
00050 
00051         /* see if there is any left to do */
00052 
00053         if (strlen(cmdbuf) != strlen(command)) {
00054                 (void) docmd(cmdbuf);
00055         }
00056         exit(0);
00057 }
00058 
00059 docmd(cmdbuf)
00060 char *cmdbuf;
00061 {
00062         return system(cmdbuf);
00063 }
